psalm.text:
[[Ps 51,3]]Have mercy on me, O God, in your goodness; 
in the greatness of your compassion wipe out my offense.
[[Ps 51,4]]Thoroughly wash me from my guilt 
and of my sin cleanse me.

[[Ps 51,12]]A clean heart create for me, O God, 
and a steadfast spirit renew within me.
[[Ps 51,13]]Cast me not out from your presence, 
and your Holy Spirit take not from me.

[[Ps 51,14]]Give me back the joy of your salvation, 
and a willing spirit sustain in me.
[[Ps 51,15]]I will teach transgressors your ways, 
and sinners shall return to you.
psalm.title: Psalms

second_reading.title: Letter to the Hebrews

first_reading.text:
[[Jr 31,31]]The days are coming, says the LORD, when I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and the house of Judah.
[[Jr 31,32]]It will not be like the covenant I made with their fathers the day I took them by the hand to lead them forth from the land of Egypt; for they broke my covenant and I had to show myself their master, says the LORD.
[[Jr 31,33]]But this is the covenant which I will make with the house of Israel after those days, says the LORD. I will place my law within them, and write it upon their hearts; I will be their God, and they shall be my people.
[[Jr 31,34]]No longer will they have need to teach their friends and kinsmen how to know the LORD. All, from least to greatest, shall know me, says the LORD, for I will forgive their evildoing and remember their sin no more.
first_reading.title: Book of Jeremiah

gospel.text:
[[Jn 12,20]]Now there were some Greeks among those who had come up to worship at the feast.
[[Jn 12,21]]They came to Philip, who was from Bethsaida in Galilee, and asked him, "Sir, we would like to see Jesus."
[[Jn 12,22]]Philip went and told Andrew; then Andrew and Philip went and told Jesus.
[[Jn 12,23]]Jesus answered them, "The hour has come for the Son of Man to be glorified.
[[Jn 12,24]]Amen, amen, I say to you, unless a grain of wheat falls to the ground and dies, it remains just a grain of wheat; but if it dies, it produces much fruit.
[[Jn 12,25]]Whoever loves his life loses it, and whoever hates his life in this world will preserve it for eternal life.
[[Jn 12,26]]Whoever serves me must follow me, and where I am, there also will my servant be. The Father will honor whoever serves me."
[[Jn 12,27]]I am troubled now. Yet what should I say? 'Father, save me from this hour'? But it was for this purpose that I came to this hour.
[[Jn 12,28]]Father, glorify your name." Then a voice came from heaven, "I have glorified it and will glorify it again."
[[Jn 12,29]]The crowd there heard it and said it was thunder; but others said, "An angel has spoken to him."
[[Jn 12,30]]Jesus answered and said, "This voice did not come for my sake but for yours.
[[Jn 12,31]]Now is the time of judgment on this world; now the ruler of this world will be driven out.
[[Jn 12,32]]And when I am lifted up from the earth, I will draw everyone to myself."
[[Jn 12,33]]He said this indicating the kind of death he would die.
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint John
